text: what we have shown them are some of the
videos from the night of March 16 gas
attack happened in the city of Sam Sam
rain also doctor tonari who is one of
the physicians who treated the patients
in that night provided eyewitness
account how is the small field hospital
that he operated was overwhelmed with
the number of the patients you had large
number of people who presented to the
hospitals with respiratory symptoms with
irritations with pulmonary edema or
fluid in the lungs and unfortunately one
of the whole family have succumbed due
to the inhalation of large concentration
of the toxic gas and as a whole family
died right and when he told all this to
the members of the Security Council who
were there what was their reaction some
of them were crying clearly I mean they
were affected but what they were seen in
the videos and what they've heard many
of them spoke outside of the diplomatic
language and many of them have said that
this is outrageous
and the perpetrators should be brought
to justice and many of them suggested
that the OPCW which is the organization
that deals with chemical weapon should
have prompt and serious investigation
the same organization that was given the
task of clearing a Syria of chemical
weapons exactly but at the same time
what has mentioned that this
organization does not assign who is the
perpetrator doesn't assignee it doesn't
assign blame it's seen as a neutral
exactly that was not their mandate which
is a problem you will be meeting the
Russian delegation at the UN what you
hope to come out of that meeting we
wanted to make sure that at least we
establish some common ground with Russia
they're one of the few countries in the
world that can influence the Syrian
regime and hopefully they can help us in
dealing with some of the difficulty
humanitarian issues I've mentioned
during the testimony that there is 23
patients in the city of Douma near
Damascus that are on dialysis and
they're blocked from getting their
dialysis fluid and if the Russian can
pressure the Syrian government to allow
this dialysis fluid to get into dumar
then that would be great and they can be
of help for us
during your testimony you were tweeting
that you'd received reports of another
chlorine gas attack what happened there
could you tell us about that and this is
very ironic you know after we finished
the testimony at doctor tannery in my
colleague who came from the city of
sermon received messages from his
hospital that they received about 20
patients who had signs of exposure to
chlorine he said that they were brought
from the city of Italy that was hit with
a chlorine bomb we don't have more
details on this issue and I'm not sure
whether this is coincidental or was a
message by someone but it's very
suspicious we're really anxious about
what's happening right now in that area
because of the dynamics on the ground we
are fearful that more attacks like this
will happen and a larger scale hopefully
we can have more information about this
recent attack tomorrow or day after
tomorrow in terms of the council we we
brought held this meeting we brought the
council members together with these
remarkable individuals because the
Security Council has come together to
pass Security Council resolution 2118
which has come a long way in dismantling
Assad's declared chemical weapons
program but that resolution which was a
resolution unusual for Syria that all
members of the council were able to
agree upon and very much the product of
us Russian cooperation in dismantling
the Syrian chemical weapons program has
not resulted in the end of chemical
weapons use in Syria it is true that we
failed to secure an ICC referral out of
the Security Council but it is not true
that that means that accountability will
not happen in Syria individuals who are
responsible for attacks like that will
be held accountable and the documentary
record is being built the testimonies
are being gathered and
the long arm of justice he's taking more
time than any of us would wish right now
but this documentary record will be used
at some point in a court of law
and the perpetrators of these crimes
need to bear that in mind
